summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 16920, entitled, "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of certain streets, avenues, alleys, public lands and places from a point beginning at the intersection of the outer harbor line and Connecticut Street to Sixth Avenue South; thence north along Sixth Avenue South to Seattle Boulevard; thence in a northwesterly direction along Seattle Boulevard to Sixth Avenue South from the north, by the construction of a main trunk sewer therein and along, and by the construction of a branch sewer from Connecticut Street and Fourth Avenue South and running north along Fourth Avenue South to Main Street, all in the City of Seattle providing for the establishing of a main trunk sewer of branch district to be known as the "Connecticut Street et al Trunk Sewer District," and providing for the creation of Local Improvement District No. 1591; all in accordance with Resolution No. 651 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle," approved on the twelfth day of September, 1907.
